DOC.brief_summary: Exercise training improve endothelium-dependent vasodilation , whereas hypoxic stress cause vascular endothelial dysfunction . Monocyte- derive endothelial progenitor cell ( Mon-EPCs ) contribute vascular repair process differentiate endothelial cell . This study investigate high-intensity interval ( HIT ) moderate intensity-continuous ( MCT ) exercise training affect circulate Mon-EPC level EPC functionality hypoxic condition . Sixty healthy sedentary male randomize engage either HIT ( 3-minute interval 40 % 80 % VO2max , n=20 ) MCT ( sustain 60 % VO2max , n=20 ) 30 minutes/day , 5 days/week 6 week , control group receive exercise intervention ( n=20 ) . Mon-EPC characteristic EPC functionality hypoxic exercise ( HE , 100W 12 % O 2 ) determine various intervention .
DOC.brief_title: High-intensity Interval Training Enhances Mobilization/Functionality Endothelial Progenitor Cells Depressed Shedding Vascular Endothelial Cells Undergoing Hypoxia
DOC.criteria: Sedentary life Age 20~28 Smokers Users medication/vitamins Any cardiopulmonary/hematological risk Regular exercise habit least 1 year Exposed high altitude ( > 3000 ) least 1 year
